title: Upload using in-app camera fails ("File not found. Please try another file") when OpenCamera installed as a default camera app
body:
### Summary

Trying to take picture from app fails - it takes the picture, and asks the user to enter metadata, but when upload starts, it complains that `file not found`.

By manually taking picture with OpenCamera first, and the using commons app button `+` and then second icon to add from gallery, adding picture works fine.

The same OpenCamera takes pictures from other apps normally, for example when [StreetComplete](https://github.com/streetcomplete/StreetComplete/) invokes it (in much the same way as Commons app does)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Have [OpenCamera](https://f-droid.org/en/packages/net.sourceforge.opencamera/) installed as a default camera app
2. in commons app, click on `+` and :camera: to invoke camera from the app
3. note that OpenCamera opens
4. click to take picture in OpenCamera
5. note that picture is shown in the background of Commons app, below modal window asking for `step 1/4 Media details`
6. complete entering media details (all 4 steps - caption, depicts, categories, license) and click `Submit`
7. app says `Upload started!`
8. seconds later app says `File not found. Please try another file.`
9. note that the picture is not present in Commons app, and its metadata is lost too. 

### Expected behaviour

In step 8, picture should be uploaded instead of error message.
In step 9, picture should be normally shown in Commons app along with all other successfully uploaded pictures


### Actual behaviour

File is not uploaded to Wikimedia commons. File is not show in Commons app, and all metadata is lost. OpenCamera does keep a copy of the picture itself, luckily, so that is at least preserved, but some other camera app might not keep local copy, so maybe even picture itself might be lost too. 

### Device name

Huawei P30Pro

### Android version

Android 10? (EMUI 12)

### Commons app version

4.0.3~cf35307d9 (latest f-droid)

### Device logs
